intro: Schizolaena exinvolucrata, commonly known as the African featherfoil, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Schizolaena exinvolucrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
